question.question: What is a typical characteristic of unilateral PFP (Peripheral Facial Palsy)?
question.option_a: Total immobility of the facial muscles on the affected side
question.option_b: Asymmetry of facial expression with immobility of the superior facial muscles
question.option_c: Synkinesis (involuntary movement of the facial muscles on the affected side)
question.option_d: Hemifacial spasm (involuntary contractions of the facial muscles on the affected side)
